intro: Microcos paniculata, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features showy, daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow central disk, blooming from late winter to early spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in full sun with well-drained soil. Microcos paniculata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its attractive foliage and long-lasting blooms.
